There arises the question: When did Wyclif spread such teachings? Scarcely had the Good Parliament been dismissed, when john of Gaunt regained the old influence, of which it had deprived him. The new parliament —- which assembled on January 27th 1377 -— was completely under his influence3 the former resolutions were formally revoked; those persons whom the Good Parliament had removed from their offices were restored to them. The situation of the clergy exposed to the new tzixation was by no means a fortunate one: but it became desperate when Wyclif⁷s blows rained down upon them.
